Download TabPatrol today and put your tabs back in control! ðŸš“ðŸš¨

TabPatrol - Version 1.0.6
New Features:
â€¢ Greek Language Support: Added full support for the Greek language. Users can now switch between English and Greek from the language selector for a localized experience.
â€¢ Enhanced Tooltips: Informative tooltips have been added across all functionalities to improve user guidance. Hover over the info icons for detailed descriptions of each feature.

Improvements
- User Interface: Minor adjustments for better alignment and readability in the settings and tab management sections.
- Bug Fixes: Resolved minor issues with the display of tooltips in different languages.

!If you have any suggestions/feedback or would like us to add extra features/languages, please send us an email with your request!

Permissions overview
TabPatrol has some permissions in order to deliver an efficient workflow. Those permissions are:
> Notifications: TabPatrol needs to be able to notify you when a duplicate is detected by its radars
> Windows: TabPatrol needs to be able to identify the active Window. It also needs to be able to access your windows so it can identify the duplicates and merge windows when requested
> Storage: TabPatrol needs to store your settings and preferences so that it can persistently manage your tabs according to your specified configurations. This ensures that your preferences, such as enabling/disabling shortcuts and other settings, are retained across sessions

With TabPatrol, you can:

> Boost Efficiency: Reduce wasted time switching between duplicate tabs.
> Enhance Organization: Maintain a clean and clutter-free browsing experience.
> Improve Workflow: Focus on the content that matters, not repetitive tabs.

Permissions overview
TabPatrol has some permissions in order to deliver an efficient workflow. Those permissions are:
Notifications: TabPatrol needs to be able to notify you when a duplicate is detected by its radars
Active Window: TabPatrol needs to be able to identify the active Window based on its custom settings
Storage: TabPatrol needs to store your settings and preferences so that it can persistently manage your tabs according to your specified configurations. This ensures that your preferences, such as enabling/disabling shortcuts and other settings, are retained across sessions.
Windows: TabPatrol needs to be able to access your windows so it can identify the duplicates and merge windows when requested
